link_name: Monitoring of Linux Logical Volumen Management (LVM)
link_desc:
Monitoring of Linux Logical Volumen Management (LVM).

There are user parameters with custom low-level discovery rules for detecting and monitoring the available LVM physical volumes (PVs), volume groups (VGs) and logical volumes (LVs).

The following logical volume types are currently supported:

  • Linear volumes
  • Thin volumes
  • Thin-pool volumes
  • Thick snapshot volumes
  • Thin snapshot volumes

Refer to the README for a list of features, supported items, triggers, graphs, macros and installation instructions.
author: Christian Affolter
